Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I spent quite a bit of time researching different travel sites for our choice of Hotel in Paris. After reading positive reviews about Hotel Lancaster we scheduled our stay there last week. We couldn't have been more pleased. It exceeded our expectations in every way. I doubt you can find a better staff top to bottom at any Hotel in Paris. We strongly recommend the Lancaster and are planning a return trip to this wonderful hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at The Lancaster... Un Petit Paradise en Paris”
Reviews.Author: labellegoulue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancaster as a family for school holidays. I have never been satisfied with any hotel in Paris that I have stayed at (maybe over 4 or 5 visits in the past 10 years) The Lancaster was warn, inviting, the staff superb and eminently helpful. All our needs were met and exceeded expectations. ~~ when it was difficult to find a taxi they offered us a complimentary limo drive to The Jules Verne Restaurant. We booked the Champagne and Breakfast Package and were regaled with the best hotel breakfasts that we have ever had in the Michelin Starred Troisgras Restaurant. We have no reservations in recommending The Lancaster to anyone who wants a superb stay in Paris... and will certainly be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Shahin1
Reviews.Content: It's quite possible to be disappointed by service in France (I'm french btw) but the Lancaster is amazing in this respect. Provided you stay a couple of nights, the staff remembers your name, what you like for breakfast and is always extremely pleasant and helpful. This is far better than most hotels of similar standards I have been to in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Treat”
Reviews.Author: MP_TA
Reviews.Content: A class act. Stunning hotel; beautifully furnished. Our suite was upgraded to one which was even more sumptuous than then one we had booked: lovely parqué floors; antique furniture; Boris Pastoukhoff oils on the walls; very carefully and discretely modernised so that it felt fresh whilst retaining its character. Service was equally discrete and thoughtful. The food was also excellent. Indeed, in many ways, Michel Troisgros's cooking reflected similar qualities to the hotel: beautifully presented, a little decadent (lobster and truffles was a treat!) , and yet restrained and carefully balanced. So, for example, the intense flavours of the venison and its rich reduction were complemented by the bitterness of the endives. Overall, hard to fault. I'd like to thank the hotel for helping to make a special occassion very special.

Reviews.Title: “"Sheer class, style and comfort"”
Reviews.Author: Beverley M
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels that we have stayed in. The service was exceptional but not intrusive and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. The hotel is furnished in a delightfully French style and our room was very comfortable. It was a pleasure to stay in a typically French hotel rather than a soul less, international environment. The location, just off the Champs Elysee, was extremely convenient for visiting most of the essential sights and museums. The food and wine was sublime and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class”
Reviews.Author: Jerry B
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. Having been let down by the original hotel we were booked into(the W Hotel; because of a delayed opening!!), we had to hastily choose an alternative; and we were not disappointed in choosing the exquisite Lancaster; what a "gem". From the moment we arrived to leaving, the staff were excellent, everyone was very friendly, informative and helpful. The decor of the room was stylish and spotlessly clean, and the hotel oozed class. The location was superb, and although on the pricey side, it was worth every penny. One of the best hotels we have stayed in, and would recommend without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lancaster for the occasion of our 30th wedding anniversary- we wanted a 5 star hotel but with some personal service that we felt the larger properties may lack. What a find! From the moment we arrived the service was second to none, each member of staff going out of their way to help in every way possible. We were called in our room each evening to confirm that night's restaurant booking and if we needed transport. Our room was at the front of the hotel on the third floor and was absolutely delightful, antique furniture with a huge comfortable bed and all facilities. The bathroom was superb with large bath and power shower. Breakfast was a treat each morning that included home made jams and yoghurts, so delicious! We can't wait to return to the Lancaster.....

Reviews.Title: “The size of a hotel doesn't have anything with the experience”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel1313
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity of staying in this hotel, due to the overbooking in a vary famous hotel, where I had made the reservation. As a person that has visited Paris many times, I did have my preference, and I thought that there wasn't a better choice. To my surprise the trip that started with the inconvenience of being bumped from the hotel I chose to the Lancaster, result in a magnificent surprise. This boutique hotel, from the moment we stepped into the lobby, gave us the impression that everyone was truly happy to see us, and determined to make our three night stay unforgettable, and that is what happened. Clean, comfortable, and with superb service. If you are planning to visit Paris anytime soon, I do recommend the Lancaster. After all a vacation experience depends on the type of service we receive, and that expectation will surely be more than met by this property;s staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with Incredible Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: Jane Q
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip through Expedia 3 days before I left and picked this hotel because of the great reviews (5 stars). This hotel exceeded all of my expectations. The staff was fantastic and went out of their way to make sure I had an amazing experience. They helped me book day trips (and rebooked one after the first company cancelled), made dinner reservations at places that I would be comfortable dining alone, the room service/restaurant staff were really friendly and the food was amazing. The room was lovely with beautiful furnishings, quiet and a radio/iPhone dock. The bathroom was like a spa, with deep soaking tub and incredible shower. What really made my trip, besides being Paris, was the staff. I already can't wait to go back in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenang
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Kirker Holidays as we were celebrating our Ruby Wedding Anniversary and wanted to stay somewhere special. We were not disappointed. From the moment we checked in everything was perfect. We were so impressed by the staff, especially those on Reception who usually greeted us by name and remembered which room we were staying in. Our room was spacious and comfortable with good lighting, heating and air conditioning. The bathroom was clean and well equipped. Our room overlooked the internal courtyard, so we did not have any noise from the street. There was a bottle of champagne in our room on arrival and when we returned later that night we had rose petals in the shape of a heart on our bed and were also brought a tray of canapes. We ate breakfast in the hotel. there was a good choice of pastries and cakes, all home made, as was the bread, along with cereals, fresh fruit, ham, cheese and smoked salmon. We could also order eggs cooked in a variety of ways. Service was impeccable but not at all stuffy. We did not eat dinner or drink in the hotel as the prices were very high, even for Paris. On the first night we had booked a restaurant nearby using Kirker`s concierge service, and were given a lift there in the hotel`s car at no extra charge. On another night the hotel concierge recommended and booked a restaurant for us. The Lancaster is not cheap, but if you want a special break with a touch of class it is well worth the money. It is also convenient, being just off the Champs Elysees and an easy walk up to the Arc de Triomph or down to the Place de la Concorde. A fabulous hotel, can`t wait for another special occasion!

Reviews.Title: “This is a hidden gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. We arrived and were warmly greeted by the front desk. They had read my profile and prepared everything according to my likes- you are therefore made to feel so special. The location is so convenient close the Champs but quietly tucked away in a side street. The hotel decor is elegant and yet hs touches of modernity in iPod docking stations in rooms and flat screen televisions. The room was superb with a balcony looking on the street below as well as the Champ. The bathroom was amazing- marble and functional. The amenities are fabulous with so many little touches. Love this hotel and will make this my permanent hotel choice in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetGirl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at the Lancaster. Having booked super last minute we managed to find a real deal including breakfast. The location off Champs Elysee is great, even though the street itself is not particularly nice. The hotel itself is an exclusive and discreet hide-away, very quiet with top notch service. The staff are extremely friendly and go out of their way to help with any requests. Due to previous comments on Tripadvisor I had requested a room overlooking the rear courtyard which was beautiful.The hotel is just finishing off a complete renovation and everything looks very french and lovely. We stayed in the basic room category and initially I was worried about the size/bed etc. However, the rooms are about 25 sqm which although not huge is a very decent size for Paris especially if you only stay 2 nights. The bed was only queen size and could have been more comfortable but with only 2 nights it's not a bid deal.The bathroom was lovely with separate WC. We had breakfast included and I have to agree with previous comments that this is probably the closest one can get to a Michelin star breakfast. Although not a huge choice everything is so beautifully presented and of course delicious. The only down side of the hotel are its extra ordinary prices with food and drinks (mini bar and lobby lounge). 10 euros for a fairly small bottle of Evian, and I think the minimum prices for simple dishes such as Onion Soup or a Club Sandwich were between 20 and 25 euros. This is probably in line with other 5 star hotels in Paris but it does feel beyond reasonable. So if you are planning to eat and drink in the hotel ensure you have a large wallet. Overall we loved our stay and would highly recommend the Lancaster for anyone wanting to experience 5 star Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Louis F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the definition of perfection. When we arrived we were welcomed by the friendly staff and shown to my suite which was fabulous with a huge balcony with views of the Eiffel tower and the Sacre Coeur. I have read previous reviews describing noise however my room was facing the street and we had absolutely no noise problems! The room was pristine, spacious and luxurious! This is definitely my favourite hotel in Paris! Nothing is to much trouble and the concierge was amazing at arranging cars and resolving any problems! This hotel is intimate, beautiful and just simply Parisienne. The bar and restaurant are also both amazing and the people who work in the restaurant were so friendly and kind to my family and I. This hotel is simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Home in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Italian_in_Boston
Reviews.Content: The Lancaster is a member of the Leading Hotels of the World (LHW) and supposedly one of the finest places to stay in Paris. But do not expect any imposing lobby or fancy staircase: this is not the place for French 'grandeur'. However, the hotel has one of the most refined qualities for a traveller: it makes you feel at home. Something similar to London's Dukes Hotel or Rome's Hotel de Russie. It is all about intimate spaces, charming and impeccable rooms, small balconies (my room, #603, had a beutiful one, from where you could catch glimpses of the Eiffel tower and Montmartre), attention to details. Its Michelin-starred restaurant ("La Table") opens graciously onto the small interior garden and the hallway - so that going there feels just like moving from your bedroom to the dining room... La Table is also where you can have your morning breakfast - one of the best ones I have ever tried in a LHW, not because of the quantity of foods but because of their quality. Possibly the closest to what could be described as a "Michelin-starred breakfast"!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nikizuk
Reviews.Content: Very good location, great rooms and excelent service!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and cosy, feel like home”
Reviews.Author: claracs
Reviews.Content: During our trip in France, we stayed in chain hotels most of the time. So we decided that we would spend a few nights in a not so big hotel when we were in Paris. Lancaster is an excellent choice. The hotel location is good; the staff is friendly, helpful and efficient. Our room is not big but very comfortable. Everything is in its logical place. (We stayed in some famous and fancy hotel before, we hated it. Too much design and not user friendly) The hotel restaurant is good too. It is not big but lovely. We only had the chance to have the breakfast and lunch there. Definitely will go for dinner next time when we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful experience here--simply the best hotel either one of us has experienced.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect small, intimate, Boutique Hotel with an amazing General Manager”
Reviews.Author: Attessa
Reviews.Content: The LancasterYES, YES,YESI Ifyou like the feel of a small boutique hotel but want to be spoiled like you are the owner you must stay here.This Hotel has a perfect location. It is a five minute walk to the Four Seasons, George V, which is an outstanding hotel by far if you like big hotels.After a small room detail was straightened out personally by the hands on General Manager, I was upgraded to a magnificent suite that was elegantly appointed with beautiful antiques and warm rich colours.My suite was large enough to comfortably entertain 60 people without being over crowded.As it was my daughter's 21st birthday and she was flying in from London for the weekend the hotel staff went far out of there way to make her stay extremely enjoyable.The concierge staff were so helpful and up to date on all the best resturauntsin Paris. They certainly had the right connections to get those impossible reservations.The food was pleasant but I can say in all fairness that I dined out with friendsmost nights

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Horatiolh
Reviews.Content: Take the Plaza Athenee and reduce it into a boutique hotel and that is what the Hotel Lancaster looks and feels like. Fabulous French decor in perfect taste and the best of French hospitality and service. From when we checked into the hotel, saw we had a two year old with us and immediately giving us a larger room so we could fit his cot comfortably to magically finding in the bathroom all these fancy 'baby' products for him. All staff were charming and attentive. Had not stayed here for years (they still had all my information) and nothing has changed...still one of the best city hotels anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service at a charming hotel can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Brigii
Reviews.Content: The Lancaster is a beautifully decorated, charming and friendly hotel. This small but lovely hotel is located just off the champes Ã©lysÃ©es, making most of the important landmarks walking distance. Or if you have too many shopping bags like a 10 euro cab ride. The staff are amazingly helpful chasing dinner reservations, opening times and train tickets for us. Every time we walk through the foyer we hear a chorus of Bonjour's The breakfast is amazing, best bread and butter todate! My only criticism, although the hotel is generally quiet no real issue with noise from the outside world, at night we can hear talking from our adjoining room. Nothing earplugs haven't solved :). We will definitely return Thanks very much Lancaster!

Reviews.Title: “Undergoing much-needed renovation....”
Reviews.Author: esmepp
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Lancaster based upon the good reviews on Trip Advisor and also due to its status as a "Leading Hotel of the World". I think that your experience here depends upon which room/suite you are assigned, and whether it has been updated or not. Upon arrival, we were informed that no upgrades or extra Leaders Club amenities were available to us since we had booked thru Expedia and not the "Leaders Club". We are new members of the Leaders Club so did not know at the time that where you book with them matters. We had reserved a "Dreamers" room. Under special requests we had indicated that it was our anniversary and we requested a room with a view. On check-in, they assured us that they had given us a lovely room. We were shown to our room which was on the 1st floor, facing the very busy, noisy, street with construction. The air conditioning was on full blast (5 degrees celsius) but was not working...room was stuffy and hot. Lots of air freshener had been sprayed in the room. We opened the large french doors to get some air and were assaulted by the street noise. There were large stains on the carpet and on the dust ruffle. The dresser drawers were left open and were full of storage junk (papers, books, etc). For $600/night we were were in disbelief. We phoned the concierge, and made it clear that we would not accept this room...and they did then make nicer accommodations for us (they gave us a Lancaster Suite on the 3rd floor overlooking the courtyard) which we greatly appreciated. After that, we had a great stay. Air conditioning still very weak, but we were able to open our windows on to the quiet courtyard. The common areas of the hotel main floor have all been renovated and are hip and gorgeous. The Michelin-starred restaurant was wonderful, very pricey, but food was excellent. Amazing breakfast buffet, especially the panna cotta with fresh raspberry sauce. Restaurant staff/service impeccable. The hotel is steps away from the Champs-Elysees, and very close to the Metro. We would consider staying here again but would make sure that we had a fully renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Still good but maybe not ageing as well as it should?”
Reviews.Author: papillon0970
Reviews.Content: I've been staying and dining at the Lancaster several times over the past five years. I like the intimate and cosy atmosphere as well as the general style. Rue de Berri is a little seedy so stick to the Champs-Elysees if you go for a stroll. The restaurant is still very good thanks to the Troisgros inspired menu but I feel the service has slipped a notch compared to a year or two ago. Last time I had lunch the Sommelier was way too pushy for my taste.... If it picks itself up then it be back up there with the best once more.

Reviews.Title: “Wow . . what a find!”
Reviews.Author: BathLawyer
Reviews.Content: Tucked away just off the Champs-Elysees, this is a simply delightful hotel. An old 19th Century converted Paris mansion. Elegant and unassuming. With a little secluded oasis of a zen garden next to the restaurant. We ate in the Michelin starred restaurant the first night (the tasting menu) . . . words fail me. It was exquisite . . . quite extraordinary and wonderful. The accompanying wines a perfect choice for each dish. The waiters were extremely knowledgeable and absolutely attentive. We loved it and will stay again and again . . . I can't imagine that anyone would be disappointed with this hotel (well perhaps the lift was a little slow . . .!)

Reviews.Title: “The Lancaster Scored High In Every Regard”
Reviews.Author: NJDogfather
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location is almost everything. Add in this fine five star hotel and you have the accommodations required for a terrific Paris vacation. The Lancaster is staffed by professionals who know how to serve guests. Whether on business or enjoying a vacation in Paris this is an excellent choice . . . only a few steps away from the Champs Elysees and convenient Metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl521
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancaster is a wonderful jewel box of a hotel, located off the busy Champs-Elysees. The street on which the hotel is located seems a bit gauche, perhaps even seedy. If you decide to go for a stroll, head in the direction of Champs-Elysees. In other words, when you exit the front of the hotel, turn right, not left. At the end of the day, I would not allow this to detract you from staying at the hotel. My husband and I have been to Paris many, many times and stayed at all the "big boys"...Georges V, Crillon, Hotel Ritz....and the Lancaster did not disappoint our discerning taste. We stayed in a suite that was huge, even by American standards. Parisian hotel rooms are notoriously small, well, this room was basically an apartment. Breakfast was excellent. The croissants were to-die-for! The staff was incredibly friendly and accomodating. The hotel's location is prime in that you are within walking distance of Le Louvre, Tuilieries, shopping on St. Honore, etc. You are also very close to Laduree on Champs Elysee (a tourist trap, but go anyway) and the "Golden Triangle," which is the area of the Hotel Georges V. Do yourself a favor...have an afternoon cocktail and nibbles at the Georges V. Yes, you will need to take out a second mortgage, but oh, what a treat! Please, please, please do not show up in sneakers and a fanny pack! This is posh Paris at its finest. Live a little! Jeans are acceptable, just dress them up a little and you will be fine. Hotel Lancaster merits a great deal of praise. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost ideal”
Reviews.Author: BRLS
Reviews.Content: A perfect small hotel with an excellent location to walk around central Paris. Service is friendly and professional, everything works effortlessly. Food is fantastic, breakfast is marvellous (not that common in France). Our only disapointment was the concierge's restaurant recommendation: A typical Paris bistro is supposed to have at least one not American guest.

Reviews.Title: “Above And Beyond, My New Elegant Home When In Paris...”
Reviews.Author: MonarchosSeven
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Lancaster, and I have never felt so welcomed anywhere before! From the moment I arrived, a lovely gentleman who introduced himself as "Errol" kindly helped me with my baggage. I was then introduced to a wonderful man, who is the hotel's lead concierge, named Mr. Eric Lemaire. He made my stay extraordinary, above and beyond all expectations possible! After checking me in, I was given a personal tour of the hotel, and then lead up to suite 66. An unexpected upgrade, with two beautiful white marble powder rooms, a lovely balcony, a luxurious spacious lounge, and a glorious bedroom fit for a princess! This hotel is Parisian charm at it's finest! The staff is warm, welcoming, and I sincerely look forward to seeing them again! Mr. Lemaire even allowed me to practice my lousy French with him, and did not make me feel shy or silly in the least! J' Adore the Lancaster!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bokwok
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 5 children (3 small children and 2 teenagers). The standard of accommodation was excellent as was the service. The staff were very accommodating with all our various needs. We had 3 interconnecting rooms all of which were beautifully furnished. The breakfast service in the dining room was excellent. Of particular note was the concierge service which was second to none. We stayed five nights and each night the concierge made an excellent dining recommendation and made the reservations for us. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant for dinner - but there was no pressure at all from the concierge that we ought to try it. Overall very good value for the standard of accommodation and service offered.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city break”
Reviews.Author: gabort Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning service. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we'd remembered”
Reviews.Author: hereinbody
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of my wife and my favourite hotels, however a recent stay has somewhat soured this experience. We were very much looking forward to a one night getaway to the Lancaster. This promptly turned into 2 nights as my wife decided to arrive in Paris 1 night early from a business trip. The hotel is still well maintained in a very nice location. Where the hotel fell down on this trip was through the service (partially). We firmly maintain that if you are paying 5 star prices (which one undoubtedly does here) then one should receive five star service. My wife was treated shoddily by certain members of the Lancaster team and was made to feel that her requests (normal given the circumstances) were exceptional with a rude / brusque response to her. It would not be correct to say this continued throughout the stay as we were very well treated the following 2 days. However she was spoken to in a frankly patronising manner and had to respond in kind to eventually get what she was asking for which was disappointing. In future we would rethink staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want a large impersonal Paris hotel, stay here”
Reviews.Author: WoofWoofLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent three (midweek) nights at the Lancaster. Don't be put off by the rue de Berri which is dominated by a huge building project or the fact that there is an ugly (empty) office block directly opposite. Stepping inside is like entering another world and you know immediately that this is a really well run hotel. The concierge desk is exceptional (especially Eric) and nothing is too much trouble - we quickly forgave them for not having our correct booking (made direct) but it did seem strange to be told that - having specifically asked for a Premier room on the garden side -all these rooms overlook the street! Our room on the first floor was large, comfortable and surprisingly quiet. The only minor niggles were that the curtains were well past their sell by date (odd for an otherwise immaculate hotel), the lighting wasn't designed for reading and the plumbling/air con were rather antiquated. As the heating was on full blast despite mild weather, it was difficult to keep the room cool without opening the windows - something worth bearing in mind in the summer. The breakfasts were excellent with wonderful fresh juices but expensive if not included in the room price. The location is superb and the fact that Metro Line 1 at George V is a few minutes walk away makes it very easy to get across Paris to the Marais/Notre Dame etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant long weekend in Paris @ the Lancaster”
Reviews.Author: LarryCable
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long weekend in Paris staying at the Hotel Lancaster. Since we booked this through our Virtuoso travel agent we obtained an upgrade from our deluxe room to a premier room on the 1st floor, facing the street. The Lancaster is perfectly located, a matter of steps from the Champs Elysees on Rue Di Beri; also a few blocks away from the prime designer shopping on Rue Faubourg St Honore. As some other reviewers have mentioned the concern about the noise, let me give you my perspective; yes its steps away from the major artery of the city, yes there is a bar across the street, yes it has 18th century sound proofing ... but is it really "noisy", in our case the answer was acceptably no. We were disturbed one morning by the recycling (bottle) garbage collection and an early morning delivery truck, and the occasional early morning riser in an adjacent room ... however overall I would say that we slept well and were not frustrated by any extraneous noise. The room (premier) was large by european standards, and very comfortable, including a flat screen tv, minibar, a writing desk and a couple of easy chairs. Again as some other reviewers pointed out there was some wear, however honestly we did not notice any of any significance, and my paranoia as created by reading such reviews was unfounded. We had a package with full breakfast included, which was enormous and delightful ... room service included. We never got a chance to try the restaurant but we did avail ourselves of the lounge and found the staff to be very friendly and attentive, Coffee, tea, wine, food and Wifi were all available. Overall the staff were SUPERB! ... very friendly, helpful and attentive, even when we had to change our travel plans to adjust for French ATC striking and our flights to London were cancelled the conceirge was there to arrange a car to take us to Gard Du Nord for the Eurostar. Also the same conceirge nailed a restaurant recommendation to Le Stella a quintessential Parisian Bisto which we would totally recommend! (We also dinied at the Buddha Bar and La Coupole in Montparnasse) Another very nice service is the complimentary limo which you may use in the evening to take you out to dinner etc. All in all, despite reading some of the negative reviews prior to staying here, all our worst fears were not realized, quite the opposite, the Lanc is a very small, sophisticated, comfortable and welcoming hotel smack in the center of Paris ... you would do well to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tryapepsi
Reviews.Content: The Lancaster is a boutique hotel. Each room is decorated differently using a "french" style. We had room 50. 51 (Livingroom) and 52. The rooms were large for Europe, the bathrooms very spacious with marble vanities, deep tubs and lavish amenties. I block from Champ Elysee. 3 blocks form George V Metro and very near the delicious patissier Laduree. The staff was very helpful and efficient. Pierre and Magalee. the concierges did a fantastic job of reconfrming and confirming all of our reservations. They also offered excellant suggestions. The buffet breakfast is usually 35 euro per person but was included in our rate. The only draw back was street noise on the Rue de Berri side around 11:00-12:00 as the hotel is across form several bars. Request a garden facing room if you are a light sleeper. Also I suggest you stear clear of using the room mini bar. Water is 8 euro! There is a Mono Prix ( Target) just down the street where you can pick up water, Pepsi, and other snacks at a reasonable price. Great place! Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service! Elite concierge staff!”
Reviews.Author: CCB056
Reviews.Content: I had wonderful stay and experience. The service was impressive!

Reviews.Title: “perfectly lovely old-style french chic”
Reviews.Author: vicandlisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a visit to watch the climax of the tour de france. Very central to champs elysees and the good bars and restaurants, metro at 150 metres. Staff were wonderful - nothing too much trouble - especially for our daughter - and they made us feel very welcome and valued. We will be back Food was good - lovely room which was spotless and great comfy beds. A little pricey at 400 per night but all in all worth it.

Reviews.Title: “really great old fashioned service hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrosulliv
Reviews.Content: I fail to see how anyone could give this hotel a bad review Stayed 2 nights with my wife and friends, Must be one of the last hotels in Paris that understands what real service is Nothing was too much trouble for the staff An excellent breakfast both in room service and in dining room. Well done to all

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ah70
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lancaster is one of the top hotels I've stayed at. The location is very nice and convenient. The staff there is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are quiet big and clean. Every thing is perfect. I really enjoyed my stay there and I thank all the staff at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a high-end hotel”
Reviews.Author: ifyouknowjack
Reviews.Content: I have been let down by many of the top hotels in Paris, which suffer from a lack of style and service for the prices they charge. At the Lancaster, rooms here are of a better standard than most, but could still do with updating a tad; however the bathrooms are modern and spacious with good amenities. Moreover, this hotel has the best front desk staff in the city, I'm sure of it. Nothing is too much trouble, there's no attitude, and they recommended some great restaurants in the area, even though the hotel itself boasts a Michelin-starred restaurant (and we didn't know it. But the breakfast is awesome!). Good public rooms for meetings (see pic), nice and central, great value: ask for a courtyard room to avoid noise from the road.

Reviews.Title: “bring the earplugs or go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: madindallas
Reviews.Content: The property is located on a loud street across from a raucous sports bar and just down the street from a strip club and disco with patrons spilling out into the street all night long. The rooms are a little tired and it looks like they could use a redo.The biggest problem is the noise. While being just off the Champs Elysees has it's advantages, it is a very loud location. The rooms in the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard are the only acceptable rooms on the property. The staff is very nice and there is a good restaurant on the property. If you must stay here, consider a room overlooking the courtyard or find alternative lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like old friends”
Reviews.Author: glennopp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents. My parents have been coming here annually for years. There are reasons they keep coming back: the service is great, the location is great and the rooms are great. They treat us like old friends. They immediately knew our names, what room we were in and where we had dinner reservations. There were bottles of champagne delivered to our rooms on arrival; fresh fruit was in the room. Every night the the bed is turned down, slippers are put out etc. The buffet breakfast was great, with a large assortment of fruits, cereals, breads, meats and cheeses. There are also hot breakfasts available. My mom had a pre-existing injury that flared up. The hotel had a doctor at their room within an hour giving excellent care. There is an adequate amount of staff to handle guests needs.... Some hotels in this recession era are understaffed... This hotel is not one of them. The only fault I found here was a guest was smoking a cigar at the front desk where it is not permitted, but the hotel staff did nothing to enforce the no smoking rules. There is a fitness center on the top floor, which is better than most in hotels. There is also free internet. We had dinner here one night, and I can recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: jamestoo
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed two nights at the Hotel over a weekend. Good Points: Staff. Front desk, Concierge and Housekeeping all very friendly, professional, personable and eager to please, with the exception of the Restaurant Manager / Maitre D. who was rude, full of self importance, and gave an heir of the worst Francofile arrogance. Bad Points: Room (52) was generally, worn, tatty, in need of a deep clean and general refurbishment. As a resident in the hotel we were unable to get a table in the restaurant for dinner! Bed: A "zip" together affair which meant i spent the night fighting my way out of the cavernous void. Room Heating: Room was cold. Despite turning the thermostat up to 30 degrees this setting made little difference. Bathroom: The nice marble bathroom with twin vanity sinks was let down by very poor water pressure on the sinks, both hot and cold was a mere dribble. The shower was a "Heath Robinson" device which took approx. 10 minutes to achieve appropriate setting and temperature, and then without warning both scalded and froze me within 30 seconds of showering. Bath: Unless you were a hobbit or midget it was not possible to use this facility. Tea and coffee facilities were not available in the room. This hotel is definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: BillTravellerTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located just steps away from the Champs and Arc de Triomphe was unbelievable perfect. The hotel itself is small and charming, with an quiet elegance. The rooms were beautifully furnished with antiques, and were generous in size. The English speaking staff was friendly, outgoing, and eager to assist. We had many special requests during our visit, from special tours, to assistance with private cars, flowers to be ordered, etc. The staff was not only helpful but generous with their time in assisting our group. I recommend this hotel! 5 star all the way. Bill

Reviews.Title: “Perct Location”
Reviews.Author: jfneto
Reviews.Content: First time staying at Champ Elysses area. Perfect hotel. Staff excelent. Breakfast to dream about. Must try the Table au Lancaster. Better than the Plaza restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “noisy Noisy NOISY!!!”
Reviews.Author: J-Class
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in many respects apart from one key one - reviewers who've complained about noise are, sadly, quite right. I was awoken at 3am by revellers in the room above mine, and the sound transmission was strong enough for me to understand parts of their conversation. As for impact, it felt as if horses were pacing around on the ceiling above. And, I should mention, I was already wearing my ear plugs so I had taken every reasonable precaution! The noise eventually died down but I lost an hour's sleep and felt pretty grumpy the next day. So, despite the Lancaster's many positives, I won't be returning - why pay luxury hotel prices for the acoustics of a crowded youth hostel?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaniellaLondon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 2 nights at The Hotel Lancaster as part of a mini honeymoon in Paris, and we weren't dissapointed at all. The staff were very friendly and welcoming to us, and remembered who we were which was a nice touch. We were in a suite, room 36 which was lovely - very bright and spacious. We had booked an alternate suite but rekocated to this one (the only problem with the hotel!). The bathrooms (yes, we had 2!!) were lovely, recently refurbished and filled with great toileteries. The bedroom was slightly older, and could probably do with a tidy up, but this wasnt too noticeable. The bose sound dock was great, and the hotel very peaceful for a break. Breakfast (available as a buffet or in room) was delicious - very French! All in all, a nice calm, unpretentious escaoe from the touristy traps of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Subdued Elegance”
Reviews.Author: LaPietra
Reviews.Content: A low-key and rather sumptious hotel on a fairly intimate scale, more like an elegant Parisian town-house than a hostelry. Despite an early arrival via the Eurostar from London, the room was ready after only a short wait on a comfortable sofa. Every possible courtesy was extended on arrival. The room was small, on the 6th floor overlooking the street, but with double sets of windows to diminish traffic noice and a tiny balcony, which was totally unexpected. The bathroom had the most wonderful "products" which were instantly replenished.. The discounted "weekend single rate" of 320 euros/night was advertised to include champagne, breakfast and newspaper. None of this materialised and b'fast was only complimentary after a negotiation with the front desk who then checked with the reservations office. But it was all handled seamlessly and politely and these minor adminstrative glitches did not blemish an otherwise outstanding experience. Breakfast was a tad dystunctional on the first day (Saturday) with a somewhat panicked staff serving the wrong things to the wrong guests. But, by Sunday, all was under the firm control of an amazingly professional restaurant manager who would not have been out of place at Windsor Castle or another royal residence, such was his poise and skill. A fabulous hotel in a central but commercial location near that retail Kasbah better known as the Champs Elysees..

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shirls45
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to Paris, we were rather nervous, but my travel agent recommended the Lancaster based on TripAdvisor reviews. And I must say it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is a treat, Its cosy and we were made to feel so welcome from the check in staff to the door man. Its location is also a bonus. Our room was lovely and the bathroom was well equipped with lovely toiletries. The breakfast was excellent. All in all loved the hotel and will most definitelly go back there again, and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “An Elegant Oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelingManSpokane
Reviews.Content: It's a pleasure to write a review of the Hotel Lancaster because it was a joy to stay there. My family of four had two adjoining and connecting rooms (King room #30 connecting to two twins). After reading some earlier reviews, I initially had some concerns about staying here but a Virtuoso travel agent convinced me to book at the Lancaster and I'm glad he did. As other reviewers have noted, this is a very classy place. Even though our rooms faced the front of the hotel (and a very busy street) we never heard much noise. Double windows helped. The rooms were elegant and comfortable. God bless air conditioning! The bathroom in Room #30 was a bit tight and we found it a little difficult to climb in and out of the shower/tub. The hotel staff was well trained and meticulous. The front desk staff was quite friendly and made many helpful suggestions. Even though the touristy Champs Elysees was half-a-block in one direction , we found some interesting shops and several really good restaurants walking the other way. I loved the ground floor terrace and adjoining lounge area. Outside was shady and cool. The petit dejeuner was world class. Truly some of the best breakfasts we've ever had and our teenagers are still talking about how good it was. This hotel's terrific location made it easy to walk to some of the area's main attractions, especially the Arc de Triumph. (Go there at dusk for an incredible view from the top of the lights coming on at the Eiffel Tower,) Yes, this is a very expensive hotel (18 Euros for a Pimms Cup!) but you certainly get what you pay for here. We got three nights in an upscale and classy urban oasis in the heart ofParis. Vive la Lancaster!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel IF You Want to be near Champs Elysees but beware of...”
Reviews.Author: voyageurNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lancaster during a weekend; it is a small hotel in the 8e just off the Champs Elysees. The positives of this hotel are that is a dignified hotel, member of Small Leading Hotels of the World; part of Amex's membership rewards and with nice renovated bathrooms with interesting Korres bath products... the room decor (as opposed to bathroom) is not modern so if that is what you are seeking, go elsewhere. But the standard room, though small, had all that one needs, and nice comfortable bed and crisp sheets, and good closet space, and did not seem run down. There was a small flat screen TV in the room, but we did not even turn it on-- who watches TV in Paris when there is so much to do? The noise can definitely be an issue at this time. Note that even if you book a room facing the courtyard (which is quiet and lovely in the middle of this area's madness), first thing in the morning the guy who was cleaning/sweep would keep dragging the chairs which made a horrible noise that you could hear above (the hotel should tell the guy to lift the chairs or put something under the chairs so they do not make that noise); AND there is construction at the corner of rue de Berri and the Champs Elysees during the week, and you can hear the noise in the hotel (even if you face the courtyard). They did not seem to be working during the weekend so was fine for most of our stay. There was one very dignified and helpful gentleman at the front desk and the other staff were fine. Overall if you will be in Paris for just a couple of days and want to be off the Champs Elysees, the hotel is a good option, but this area is a very busy area, full of tourists. On the plus side also are that it is close to several metro stations (George V and Franklin Roosevelt) and the Etoile; Place de la Concorde are within very easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “No longer what it was”
Reviews.Author: losangelestrapper
Reviews.Content: Ten years ago this was the most luxurious and well kept hotel in Paris. It's now shopworn. The the carpets are fraying, the upholstery is fading, the bedding sagging, and the staff are just OK. (They had a hard time suggesting exhibits and truly good restaurants in the neighborhood, something easy enough to do on line). Of course that brings up the absence of internet connectivity anywhere but in the lobby. They seem to have a hard time telling you that. It is always in repair. Always. On check out I was next to a lady asking that they fix her hot water. In one of my night stays they had to bring up a heater because it wasn't working. That's just crazy. There are so many good hotels at this price point I no longer feel the need to go. It was once the most lovely and cared for luxury hotel in Paris. I'll go to the Bristol next time.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: maayan98
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights last year. the location is brilliant, the room was small, but larger than avarage hotle rooms in paris. The design is historic, which is my favorite for earopean hotels. the best thing was breakfast- the best I have ever ate. also the cappuchino was great, almost like in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Terribel hotel with terrible rates”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulcn
Reviews.Content: we share the same experiences like other reviewers who had terrible experiences and bad treatment at Lancaster. Noise from overall directions (street and other rooms) due to the poor sound insulation and run down hotel conditions. The manager is arrogant and hostile. The room rate is the same as the rate charged by some of the five star hotels in Paris but the hotel only provides 1 star services in addition, as a light sleeper, i can feel the ghost haunt during the night. the room is big but not practical and useless it seems the space is provided to house their own old furniture and "owners of mansion" as we can feel the ghost haunt during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Adzema
Reviews.Content: I was at the Lancaster for only one night in early July. The rooms are tiny and expensive, but this is standard for Paris. The standard room was fine for me, one person, but I could see how it could be cramped for two. Hotel (although not the block it is on) is beautiful. I had a room that faced the inner courtyard and prescription sleeping pills so noise was not an issue at all, but the soundproofing is as one would expect from an 18th century building. The staff was above and beyond my expectations. The decor was excellent. The lunch I had at the hotel restaurant was in the top five meals I've had in my life. I find this area (8th arron.) a bit sterile for my taste (Champs Elysee is a bit too much like the upscale shopping district near where I live) but I still found lots to like nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-too much noise”
Reviews.Author: xcapeohio
Reviews.Content: The Lancaster is a great hotel; beautiful rooms, amazing staff, nice amenities. However, if you get one of their rooms that face the street, be prepared for hearing a great deal of noise all night long. Unfortunately, there are few rooms which do not face the street. I am not sure why a hotel this luxurious, that is trying to cater to an upscale clientel, would not invest in better sound proofing. I had read many of the previous reviews that stated this was a problem but was not concerned because we are heavy sleepers. We were constantly awoken each night to loud sounds from the street, or one night we could hear the people upstairs arguing at 3 in the morning. Lancaster, listen to what the reviewrs are saying!! I would not return here for fear of being placed in a street room again. This is a shame because it is a 5 star hotel in every other way. If you go, make sure your room doesn't face the street, or that you are a very heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Lancaster”
Reviews.Author: Enjoythemoment
Reviews.Content: I guess I could sum it up by saying I'll go elsewhere next time in Paris. The location is good. The staff is very helpful. The restaurant is first class But you could hear the movement in the rooms above and next door. The rooms are just ok. I wish I could find a hotel in Paris like the Hotel Arts Barcelona or the Portrait Suites, Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lancaster”
Reviews.Author: heme34
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed 2 nights at Lancaster early May. Location is just off Champs-Elyssee below Arc de Triumph. Is a LHW hotel . We had a Jr suite that was very large and well furnished. Service was attentive. The food for breakfast and dinner was wonderful. Also had fitness room we used and enjoyed. For quiet,classical ambience in 8th Arr this is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Another Underwhelming Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MayfairChino
Reviews.Content: The good: Hotel Lancaster has a great location, right off CE, near many good restaurants and bars. Lovely common area. Friendly staff. Free internet use. DVD in room. Clean bathrooms. The bad: the standard rooms are really small. Being an old hotel, the sound proof is terrible. I could hear all kinds of noisy from upstairs at night. I am a light sleeper so this is really agitating. The room is really cold and i was told to turn off air conditioning completely to solve the problem. Yikes.

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet”
Reviews.Author: Swindoneric
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. Gem of a hotel and I only wish that i had brought the wife and made a weekend of it. Everyone really friendly. Common areas gorgeous, room old-fashioned Parisien chic but really peaceful given that it is about 100m from the Champs. Probably more of a weekend hotel than a business hotel but I'd stay there again like a shot.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pa2
Reviews.Content: Just popped into the hotel for an afternoon tea. Loved the lobby and service. They were most attentive in the library bar area overlooking a Christmas time courtyard with several pine trees and horsetail. The place is just beautiful with asian accents in the decor. This is the first boutique type hotel of its kind which has transcended travel as we know it. Next time in Paris, I will stay at this wonderful mansion. While its location next to the Champs Elysees is great, the street it is located on is a bit run down but discretely away from high volume traffic and noise. Wonderful hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Splendor and Graciousness at the Lancaster”
Reviews.Author: tang
Reviews.Content: The location of this quiet hotel is perfection- only one block from Fauboug St Honore and one block from the Avenue George V. Nonetheless it is quiet and somewhat removed from the tackiness of the Champs.My room (40) was huge and beautifully decorated - bed linens were lovely and the bed itself was firm. Standard of housekeeping was excellent and I found the staff to be extremely courteous and obliging, ( in fact they were fun) particularly the concierge desk which made reservations for us all over town with no problem and which offered their own helpful suggestions. The crowd at the hotel is nice - lots of brits and italians, unlike the louche group at the Plaza Athenee. This hotel has more of a Venetian look to it than other hotels similarly priced - the colors are faded and tasteful, not loud and bright, - and for the price gives excellent value for money. In fact the word 'gloomy' comes to mind in describing the bar area but 'tasteful gloomy' - lots of ochre, deep reds and mauve - very hip, with a nice outdoor bar. Breakfasts were copious and very tasty and the coffee was excellent thankfully - the restaurant here becomes the kitchen of famed chef Michel Troisgros at night and I regret not having taken more meals here. No wonder Marlene Dietrich chose this place to live towards the end of her life. A hip, delightful home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant Faded Glory!”
Reviews.Author: Savant66
Reviews.Content: If you are seeking extreme Parisian arrogance with an inflated sense of self importance, trading off past glories....welcome to The Lancaster! Unfortunately the past negative reviews are all true! especially "Rude snobbish staff" and "17th century rooms at 21st century prices" I was prepared to overlook the tired decor of the "Prestige" room, the 30 year old lighting and a television worthy of a road-side motel. I was even prepared to overlook the poor quality and expensive (30 euros) wireless internet and the cigarette burns on the furniture. However, the behaviour of the Matre'D and her staff in the restaurant was unforgiveable. My wife and I decided to enjoy a pre-dinner drink in the very stylish lobby bar and outdoor garden. (All the investment is clearly spent on the lobby and nothing on the rooms). During our time in the bar a waiter asked if we would like to dine at their restaurant....we asked for a menu, which was delivered. Five minutes later, the same waiter emerged to advise that the restaurant was full and they would let us know if they had a cancellation. Five minutes after that the waiter asked for our room number and indicated that we could have a table. Eventually a very arrogant woman, who I assumed was the Maitre'D, emerged to tell us they were full and that we could not dine at the hotel. I have no idea why they started this process other than to indulge in some pathetic display of arrogance and predjudice. I can only assume that when they checked our reservation, they determined that we were staying on a heavily discounted promotional rate and were not worthy of their temple of gastronomy! What an unpleasant experience. Unless you want to pay three times the price than is neccesary for a room that is desperately in need of renovation, then I would strong advise you to look elsewhere. However, if you gain some pleasure in being treated as a second class citizen by arrogant and self-important restaurant staff, then this is place to come! The Lancaster has had its time in the sun and its glory days are well over...

Reviews.Title: “Super chic Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Elisa&Leo-ontheroad
Reviews.Content: We were there for just a weekend but it was a lovely one - the Hotel is an excellent location, right off Champs Elysees, 5 minutes walking from Arc de Triomphe. It's superchic, very well decorated, spacious room and bathroom, it really makes you feel a princess. Just ask to DO NOT have a room overlooking the street, cause it is very very noisy. The Concierge and Reception staff is very knowledge, just they didn't give me the impression of friendlyness.. and it seems like they speak just french, even if I'm sure they dont. I speak English and French, but more English, but we always ended up talking in French.. Like you ask in English and they first answer in French... We tried the restaurant, it was a nice atmosphere, excellent service (especially the maitre and the waiter from Italy), good food, even I wasn't lucky with my choice and I din't enjoy too much; my boyfriend dish was delicious. Next time I might want to try some Hotel in a more lively and Parisien area, cause around Champs Restaurants are touristic and it feel a bit fake. But the Hotel is superbe.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Lancaster”
Reviews.Author: Poshexpert
Reviews.Content: Booked at the last minute through deluxe hotel website. Single room 28 but also 27 is excellent. I have no idea why the negative reviews. This is really a deluxe and five star hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Excellent experience in the dining room and also for room service. There are so many public rooms and a lovely court with an excellent place to meet for a drink or dinner. The room â€” recommend you book on the court â€” was very comfortable and the single bed was more like a double bed. Large closets, bathroom and beautifully furnished. It was very quiet. Also the TV had a DVR and this worked for all my American films. The food is major destination in France and certainly the Lancaster Hotel compliments in a very five star way. In the USA we have many hotels claiming to be 5 star but this is only an advertising gimmick. The Lancaster is very convenient and I picked up a cold on my last day and it was great to find a 24 hour pharmacy across from the hotel. Where would you find this in the USA? I love the location and if you go north, away from the Champs Elysees, you will find neighborhoods with great restaurants. I of course love Paris and France and donâ€™t share the anti-French opinion of the current USA administration or Pres. Bush and quite frankly Iâ€™m glad these type of Americans avoid France. I find France and Paris continually my favorite European destination.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy Charges”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4-night reservation for March 2006, directly through the hotel. All correspondence was done through email. I had emailed my credit card number to guarantee my reservation before departure and requested an email confirmation number as I had yet to receive a confirmed reservation number or email. When I arrived in Europe, I checked my email and found that I had mistyped a digit in my credit card number and that my card was invalid, and my reservation unconfirmed. My partner called the hotel directly and spoke to a gentleman at the front desk. My partner provided the correct credit card number and asked for a confirmation, but this gentleman indicated he was not in reservations and could not confirm. As the Hotel Lancaster is part of the Leading Hotels of the World, and I am a President's Club member, I contacted LHW in the US. They could not pull, through any of their systems, our reservations and said that the hotel was full. Three times I emailed the hotel to secure a confirmation, but I never received a response. My partner tried calling again, but he was unsuccessful in securing any word of "confirmation". We, therefore, scrambled to secure a last minute reservation in Paris. Imagine my surprise to receive a $941 charge to my Visa upon my return for a reservation no-show. The hotel firmly implores that we had a confirmed reservation, yet we had no confirmation number and our last written email from the hotel said our reservation was now unconfirmed. Three full months of wrangling with the hotel and with Visa proved fruitless. The $941 charge stuck. I travel domestically and internationally on a weekly basis. This is the first time, in over 16 years, that I have ever been charged a no-show, because I completely understand how reservations, confirmations, and cancellations work. Despite having everything in writing and a cell phone log, I still got stuck with the charge. I firmly believe this experience speaks to the Hotel Lancaster's position on customer service, or as the case may be, utter lack thereof. Be cautious of booking directly (or possibly even indirectly) with this property. This was an expensive experience that will never be forgotten on my end.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful in Every Possible Sense”
Reviews.Author: KalihiKai
Reviews.Content: Rather than an exhaustive rant of such a horrid place, suffice it to say CAVEAT EMPTOR. The staff is rude, unattentive, and snobbish. There is nothing redeeming to say about this hotel. Never consider this place when you have such fine other choices in Paris like George V, Ritz, or the Crillon. Don't for a second give the Lancaster a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Bunbun
Reviews.Content: Having spent 3 days at the Hotel Lancaster in Paris recently, thought I should inform future Trip Advisors of the paper thin walls in this hotel. Booked this room through the website that appears on Tripadvisor, so don't know whether you an get inferior room, there is also an overcharge on my visa statement by Â£250, be wary. We may have been particularly unlucky, but had a rather amorous couple in the next bedroom who were extremely noisey which was quite annoying at 2 in the morning. So I would suggest you check which room you are allocated and stay well away from room 22 and 21!

Reviews.Title: “Stealth wealth!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lancaster during the Easter weekend. We checked in on the Friday night and were warmly welcomed by the reception staff. For the first night, we asked the concierge to recommend just a simple place for light bite. He got us into a fabulous local brasserie! On Saturday, we picked on the concierge brain again and he set up a perfect walking tour of Paris for us: shops, monument, lunch, more shops. We came back exhausted but happy. They had a surpise in for us on Sunday morning! As we came down for breakfast, the maitre d' gave us homemade chocolate eggs for Easter! Our room was very pretty. It was facing the courtyard and was therefore very quiet. The bathroom had just been repainted and our room was in perfect condition. All the staff we met was extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The atmosphere once you walk into the hotel is incredible: it is peaceful, homely, elegant yet relaxed and the staff made the whole experience even more friendly. We strongly recommend the Lancaster to anyone who wants a five star experience in a smaller, more personal environment and at four star prices!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem - how can one not like it?”
Reviews.Author: jwpetch
Reviews.Content: I had a short one night romantic stay here to celebrate my birthday and cannot write more highly - the staff are so friendly and efficient - one gets the feeling of walking into an elegant private home as soon as you cross the front door - a warm welcoming working fireplace at the reception desk adds to the human welcome from the checkin staff. Our room suite 80 was on the 8th floor and tastefully decorated with antique furniture (apparently collected by the founder), cosy red silk wallcoverings, a big king bed and modern marble bathroom with deep fluffy towels and bathrobes - but the special feature was the full length balcony that gave us birds eye views of the roofs of Paris and especially the Eiffel Tower and Sacre Coeur ( the perfect romantic view as one always dreams of!) The second treat was dinner in the 1 star Michelin restaurant looking onto the central courtyard garden (too cold be out there but will have to come back in the summer ) - what a way to spend one's birthday. Having travelled all over the world the warmth, comfort and professionalism of this hotel I have not found elsewhere - as another tripadvisor said, I don't know where those who had bad experiences stayed..... I can but recommend it and will do so to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “17th Century Comfort at 21st Century Prices”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are a discerning business traveller or someone with high expectations who is willing to spend a bit more for a special experience, do not choose the Lancaster (unless you have a very different definition of the word "special"). Unfortunately, I chose this hotel based on positive reviews on this site. I agree with prior reviewers that the rooms are large and the staff is friendly. That's where it ends. The rooms, while large, are gloomy. Carpet and wall coverings appear to be coated in a fine layer of grime (even though the staff told me that my room was recently renovated). While the furnishings may have originally been comfortable for Louis XIV, I doubt they'd be comfortable for you! The beds are sunk down low with a hard rock mattress. Even the beds at the lowly Marriott are far superior to the Lancaster's. For the business traveller, expect to pay $40 for WiFi access while you sit at Louis' 3 foot desk in a rickety wooden chair. For reading at your desk or in bed, the main lighting is a chandelier at least 20 feet above your head. And while the bathroom was large and also apparently recently renovated, it featured an open shower, which was designed to allow water to flow all over the bathroom floor. So for those who decide not to heed this advice and take your chances, make sure you get a room facing the back of the hotel and ask for a real king bed. The staff told me that they frequently give guests a "king" by placing two twins together. Au Revoir and Bon Chance!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HJPofi
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the lesser reviews of this hotel and wonder where these people stayed. It obviously wasn't the Hotel Lancaster I was at for 5 nights. The staff was superb. New my name, my drink and what time I liked to get up in the morning. The doorman had a ready umbrella when it rained. The staff made dinner reservations and had a cab waiting every night without even having to ask. The room was large with huge closets. The bathroom was very nice. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. This was my 5th vacation in Paris and the hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: gb905
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and the staff superb! We went there because of previous ratings and couldn't have been happier. The view from the terrace wasn't that great but the service and the restaurant more than made up for it! It's not cheap but well worth the money. The location is just off the Champs so shopping and people watching were moments away.

Reviews.Title: “When in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SAC40
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's acknowledged that The Lancaster suffers from not being located on a particularly pretty street. What it does have though is great style, understated it must be said, great service and delivered with charm too. My room on the 6th floor was really beautiful. The walls are covered in silk, the paintings and antiques are all exquisitely well chosen. My room had a little terrace which was charming. I was lucky that when we visited the sun was shining and we were able to eat breakfast on the terrace, looking over the rooftops to Monmartre. The garden is justifiably famous, very zen and would be a great setting for dinner in the summer. As far as I could see 'dinner' was the only problem .. really annoying menu that makes it difficult to order well. Then when you do order from the 'spicy' or 'green' or 'sour' section, it's really not that good ! Great hotel, great garden, not great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was great!”
Reviews.Author: carwasher1
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after a full week stay the last week of October. I read some of the negative reporting but found non of it...quite to the contrary...I found the staff accommodating and helpful in every respect. I'm trying to find somethiong negative but other then the room needing minor attention and the shower small (at least we had a shower), everything else worked like a clock. Sven, the Assistant Concierge was the most helpful and likewise got us into every restaurant we asked for even on relatively short notice. I know that these reviews are very subjective and rely on expectations, but all my reservations about the hotel were for naught. Yes it's down the street from Flint's place but we didn't even know it until maybe the fourth or fifth day (it was so inconspicuous). The Rue de Berri is a street like you'd find off Times Square New York or Union Square, San Francisco. It is in the heart of busy tourist area near the Arc d Triumph (spelling?). If quiet, little street is your interest...this is not the place. But if you want to be in the heart of it and near the Metro system, this is a great place with very accommodating personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay - Issue of Consistentcy?”
Reviews.Author: W00dy20stkw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Lancaster for a week this October - we probably overlapped the stay of the previous reviewer. On the whole, we had a very good experience at the Lancaster and didn't have the service problems experienced by others. I had communicated with the Lancaster's concierges via e-mail for several weeks before we arrived. They arranged a car to pick us up at the Charles de Gaulle Airport - and the driver and car were on time and very comfortable. The concierges also got us dinner reservations at every restaurant we wanted to get into, notwithstanding we arrived in the middle of the fall "Fashion Week" in Paris. And we didn't have problems with our daily paper (the European edition of the Wall Street Journal - extra copies were also available on a table in the lobby). As we took taxis every night we got to know the doormen who were very friendly and helpful. Overall, our great experience and personal interaction with the staff was probably the highlight of our stay at the Lancaster. We had a deluxe room (it is pictured in the Expedia website above - the room with the red-rose furnishings). It was good sized and very comfortable considering the rooms we've stayed in at other smaller Paris hotels. I would agree with the prior reviewers that the location of the room is a significant factor to the enjoyment of the Lancaster. Rooms facing the interior courtyard are quieter in the morning. Our room faced the Rue de Berri. Luckily we got up pretty early each morning. Sleeping in would be difficult considering the noise from the street but the room was perfectly quiet at night. We also were a bit disappointed by the location. The pictures of the hotel reflect its intimate town-house character. But the street it is located on, Rue de Berri, is very commercial and dark. But our disappointment was in part balanced by having the Champs, the George V metro stop and the Arc de Triumph all so very close.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, surprisingly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rbwinston
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lancaster in mid-October 2005. Had read a number of good reviews. On the positive side, it is on a quiet (if not seedy, next to Larry Flynt Hustler Club), well located (much quieter than being on the Champs Elysees) street. Has the feel of staying at a large private residence. Rooms are large and reasonably appointed, but paint, carpet and decor is tired. Views can be terrible for the wrong rooms. The staff tries, but misses. They offered a specific paper in the morning - I got the wrong one both days. They ordered a cab for my day of departure - it wasn't there, but they procured one for me after 15 minutes of scrambling around. They gave me the wrong room key twice upon return to the hotel. The rooms are surprisingly quiet at night, but hard to sleep in in the mornings. I was solo and on business, so this was not a big deal - but I would not call this a romantic hide-a-way. The exercise room is small - one bike, one stepper machine and a single weight unit. Better than most small European hotels, but don't be fooled by descriptions. Spend the extra and stay up the street at the George V or spend less and be right in the mix at the Marriott Champs. The value just isn't there for the price.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Lancaster
HotelInfo.Address: 7 Rue De Berri | 8th Arr., 75008 Paris, France
